greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of q * f(-q^4)^6 / phi(-q) in powers of q where phi(), f() are Ramanujan theta functions.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) (see A121373), phi(q) (A000122), psi(q) (A010054), chi(q) (A000700).
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..2500
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: Expansion of q * phi(q) * psi(q^2)^4 in powers of q where phi(), psi() are Ramanujan theta functions.
Expansion of eta(q^2) * eta(q^4)^6 / eta(q)^2 in powers of q.
G.f. is a period 1 Fourier series which satisfies f(-1 / (4 t)) = 2^(-3/2) (t/I)^(5/2) g(t) where q = exp(2 Pi i t) and g() is the g.f. for A245643.
mathematica: a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ q QPochhammer[ q^4]^6 / EllipticTheta[ 4, 0, q], {q, 0, n}];
a[ n_] := SeriesCoefficient[ 2^-4 EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, q] EllipticTheta[ 2, 0, q]^4, {q, 0, n}];
program: (PARI) {a(n) = my(A); if( n<1, 0, n--; A = x * O(x^n); polcoeff( eta(x^2 + A) * eta(x^4 + A)^6 / eta(x + A)^2, n))};
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Jan 03 2016
